statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: Dion Wright sank 11 of 17 field goals to score a career-high 28 points as St. Bonaventure defeated Niagara 82-68 on Wednesday night.
article.headline: St. Bonaventure pulls away from Niagara for 82-68 win
article.linkText: St. Bonaventure pulls away from Niagara for 82-68 win
article.story: ST. BONAVENTURE, N.Y. -- Dion Wright sank 11 of 17 field goals to score a career-high 28 points as St. Bonaventure defeated Niagara 82-68 on Wednesday night. Jaylen Adams added 16 points with 12 assists, and Nelson Kaputo scored 14 for the Bonnies (8-3). After four early lead changes, St. Bonaventure's crisp shooting -- making a season-high 12 3-pointers -- helped it pull away to a 35-27 halftime lead. Niagara (3-10) led by eight to open the game and was paced by Emile Blackman's 19 points. Cameron Fowler added 14. The Purple Eagles stepped up their shooting from nine made field goals in the first half to 16 after the break. Fowler capped an 8-0 run to open the second half and bring Niagara to within 35-33, but Kaputo and Adams banged down consecutive 3-pointers for the Bonnies, moving the lead up to 43-34 with 16:26 left. Five minutes later, the lead was 20, 59-39.
